unnormalised: Okay, buckle up, petrolheads! Let's talk fuel efficiency, or as I like to call it, the art of stretching every drop of petrol like it's the last samosa at a wedding. My car, affectionately nicknamed "Bessie the Beetle," drinks fuel like I drink chai on a rainy day. And trust me, that’s saying something.

My car, affectionately nicknamed "Bessie the Beetle," drinks fuel like I drink chai on a rainy day. And trust me, that is saying something.

unnormalised: So, I decided enough was enough. I was tired of the petrol station guy knowing me better than my own family. I started researching ways to squeeze every last km out of Bessie. Apparently, driving like a maniac (which, I admit, I sometimes do after a particularly frustrating day dealing with traffic in Bangalore) isn’t the best approach. Who knew?

Apparently, driving like a maniac (which, I admit, I sometimes do after a particularly frustrating day dealing with traffic in Bangalore) isn’t the best approach. Who knew?

unnormalised: First up, tire pressure. Who checks that, right? Well, turns out, underinflated tires are like running a marathon in flip-flops. They drag, they slow you down, and they guzzle fuel. So, I inflated Bessie's tires to the recommended 32 PSI. Felt like she grew wings! Okay, maybe not wings, but definitely less like she was dragging a sack of potatoes.
normalised: First up, tire pressure. Who checks that, right? Well, turns out, underinflated tires are like running a marathon in flip-flops. They drag, they slow you down, and they guzzle fuel. So, I inflated Bessie's tires to the recommended thirty two P-S-I. Felt like she grew wings! Okay, maybe not wings, but definitely less like she was dragging a sack of potatoes.

unnormalised: Then there's the whole "excess weight" thing. I’m not talking about *me*, of course. I’m talking about the random junk I cart around in Bessie’s trunk. Old cricket bats, a broken umbrella, half a toolbox, and enough shopping bags to open a plastic recycling plant. I cleared it all out. I swear, Bessie actually sighed in relief. Lost about 50 kg of unnecessary baggage!

Lost about fifty kilogram of unnecessary baggage!

unnormalised: Next, the real shocker: regular servicing. I know, I know, it sounds boring, but apparently, a well-maintained engine runs smoother and uses less fuel. Who would've thought? My mechanic, Raju, told me my air filter was so clogged it looked like it had been collecting dust from the moon. A new filter, some fresh oil, and Bessie was purring like a kitten. Or, you know, a well-oiled Beetle.

unnormalised: And then there's the driving style. Turns out, accelerating like you're auditioning for a Fast and Furious movie is a major fuel guzzler. Smooth acceleration, gentle braking, and maintaining a consistent speed are the key. It’s like driving a bullock cart, but without the bullocks… or the cart. Aiming for a steady 60 kmph (when possible, thanks to peak hour traffic!) seems to be the sweet spot.

Aiming for a steady sixty kilometer per hour (when possible, thanks to peak hour traffic!) seems to be the sweet spot.

unnormalised: Now, about the AC. Living in Chennai, AC is not a luxury, it’s a necessity. But Raju told me using the AC at full blast all the time can impact fuel efficiency by as much as 20%. I tried rolling down the windows… once. Lasted about 5 minutes before I was covered in dust and sweat. Compromise is key.

Lasted about five minutes before I was covered in dust and sweat. Compromise is key.

unnormalised: Let’s talk units. I started meticulously tracking Bessie's mileage. Kilometers per litre, litres per 100 km – I was drowning in units! Turns out, it *does* make a difference. All those little tweaks I made actually resulted in a noticeable improvement.

unnormalised: Bessie was now giving me about 18 kmpl within the city, compared to the abysmal 12 kmpl I was getting earlier. That's like finding ₹500 in your old jeans! Okay, maybe not that exciting, but still… more chai money!

unnormalised: So, there you have it. My hilarious (and slightly desperate) journey to improve fuel efficiency. Remember, folks, every little bit counts. Drive smart, not furious, and maybe, just maybe, you can outsmart the petrol pump. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm off to celebrate with a well-deserved cup of chai. And maybe, just maybe, I'll even use the AC!
